DOC.brief_summary: This study will evaluate the efficacy and safety of clostridial collagenase injections for treatment of Dupuytren's contracture of the thumb and first web space. The investigators hypothesis is that clostridial collagenase will have safety not significantly different to that demonstrated in Phase III clinical trials, and will be effective in significantly reducing the degree of thumb contracture.
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Xiaflex Injection for Treatment of Dupuytren's Contracture of the Thumb
DOC.criteria: Adult subjects (> 18 years) of either gender with an MP and/or IP joint contracture and a palpable cord of > 20 degrees of the thumb First web space contracture with a palpable cord due to Dupuytren's contracture Prior surgical, percutaneous needle aponeurotomy or Xiaflex treatment for Dupuytren's contracture of the same thumb. Any subject using anticoagulant therapy other than low dose aspirin (up to 150mg/day). Any subject in the opinion of the MD investigators with chronic, severe or terminal medical illness which would make them unsuitable for study participation. Any subject with known allergy to Xiaflex (Clostridial collagenase). Pregnant or nursing female Any subject who cannot conform to the study visit schedule
